website_summaries.verdict: This award-winning cat toy will keep your feline busy for hours. Just hang it over a doorknob and let the fun begin. Our best pick.
pros: Exciting, battery-operated toy has a heavy silk cord attached to an elastic "conveyor belt" that flings the string around
Toy hangs on doorknob and attaches to door with elastic
cons: Requires three "AA" batteries and uses them up quickly

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware this caused damage to my cats eye.
customer_reviews.text: At first we loved it. We would turn it on and she would play for hours. On day we heard her cry and run away from it. A day or two later she developed an this on her eye. The eye specialist, (yes we had to bring our cat to an animal eye specialist after the hospital could not figure out what happened). After showing him the video he said the string must have whipped her in the eye and to throw it out immediately. Buyer beware the bill came to $1,500.00
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: Still going strong after a year of hard play
customer_reviews.text: My two large active 2 year old tabbies still go nuts for this and they are not gentle about it. They pull out the string when it's not on. When it's on, they grab and hold the string while the mechanism grinds away and still the toy works. My advice: 1. Location matters. If it's ignored in one location, try another and 2. "Retire" the toy periodically to keep it fresh for your cat.
customer_reviews.author: Susan B.

customer_reviews.title: I really wanted to love this. But it drains batteries like there is ...
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to love this. But it drains batteries like there is no tomorrow. It was literally running maybe 10 minutes, barely long enough for them to even realize it was going. I came back into the room and it was completely dead. I have had it a very short time and already went through 3 sets of batteries. There is no point in that for the maybe 10 minutes they got to play with it. My boy did like it, and had it actually lasted, I might have given a better feedback.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Hands Down the Best Cat Toy - Cat Approved
customer_reviews.text: I have six cats that have different preferences in what they enjoy playing with such as balls, play mice, laser pen light and various feather toys. But, the one toy that 6 out of 6 approve of is the Moody Pet Fling-Ama-String. It keeps them entertained for hours. Many times they sit in line waiting to take their turn. Attached is a photo of 5 of them using it/waiting in line. I also purchased a second one as a gift for a friend. It's so easy to install. Just insert the batteries and hang it on a door. The company also provides exceptional customer service. I guarantee your cat(s) will absolutely enjoy playing with this toy.
customer_reviews.author: Miannke

customer_reviews.title: Resulted in Emergency Vet Visit
customer_reviews.text: Do NOT purchase this product. When it was turned off, our cat was still able to get to the very LONG string and chew it right off. She also swallowed it all which resulted in an emergency vet visit. For the safety of your fur baby, do NOT purchase this product- I wish I never purchased it.
customer_reviews.author: Michele Pollock

customer_reviews.title: My cat loves this!
customer_reviews.text: This is my cat's favorite toy by far! He has used and abused it. He's pulled the strap out as far as it would go and it just popped back and kept going. He's twisted the belt and it's just kept on. It does eat batteries like crazy but the entertainment is well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: H. Murray

customer_reviews.title: Missed return date by the weekend
customer_reviews.text: The cats do like it for the 5 minutes it works. I have changed batteries 6 times in less than a month and I don't leave it on when they walk away. Not worth it due to the battery waste. This is just a toy that makes a band go around in a circle with 3-THREE AAA batteries. Such a small motor should be able to run non-stop for a day or 2 on 3 AAA but it can't run for more than a few hours before it needs new batteries. Product needs an overhaul and a timer or motion sensor so I can keep working when they bang on it, lol
customer_reviews.author: cj

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: This thing eats batteries so fast it's not worth it. I put fresh batteries in and it'll go for 20 mins before it dies and needs new ones.
customer_reviews.author: KL

customer_reviews.title: They absolutely love this toy but I cannot get it to work
customer_reviews.text: The reason I give this product a one-star review is because it broke right away, but just outside of the return window. It broke my kitties hearts too! They absolutely love this toy but I cannot get it to work. I've changed the batteries multiple times, messed with the conveyor belt, done everything but entirely disassemble it. I'm really upset about it but I can't just spend $20 every couple of weeks on a toy that is just going to keep breaking for no apparent reason. I haven't found a way to get in touch with the manufacturer either, or any kind of customer service. Altogether extremely disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: sflnative

customer_reviews.title: Entertaining toy for cats, but supervision is key
customer_reviews.text: I have had this unit for a couple of weeks and so far my cat is still entertained and asks for us to turn it on by meowing at the closet we keep it in! The design leaves something to be desired aesthetically but structure-wise it has been holding up so far and she has not been able to detach the string from the conveyer belt. I would stress that it should be a supervised toy only. Due to the concern that the string can be pulled off and ingested, we put the unit away when she's not playing with it.
customer_reviews.author: CDA

customer_reviews.title: When this happens the device will make loud noises which scared my cats and didn't give them the fun experience we expected
customer_reviews.text: The problem with this device is since it's battery powered, the cats will inevitably catch and hold onto the string. Additionally the belt catches alot on it's own which prevents it from moving properly which then causes damage eventually to the motor. When this happens the device will make loud noises which scared my cats and didn't give them the fun experience we expected. They eventually avoided it because they were afraid it would make that loud noise again.
customer_reviews.author: Chad

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product - for about 20  minutes
customer_reviews.text: Given as gift and opened Christmas morning. Simple installation. Cat loved it immediately. After about 10 minutes cat withdrew to watch it from across the room. After about 20 minutes it simply stopped working. We thought it was batteries. Replaced them next day. It wasn't the batteries. Product simply stopped working. Could be because too many people were staring at it. Should be a product warning if it is that delicate. Manufacturer says it accepts returns - Ho Ho Ho Merry Christmas - NOT/Fail.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Prunty

customer_reviews.title: Stupid cat
customer_reviews.text: My cat hates everything and is barely interested in this toy. Granted, I may have a defective cat, but the only thing she has shown interest in is a thing that spins a stick around in a circle. This seemed like a similar concept, but no dice. All I get is a confused/disinterested look, like I’m a bitter disappointment when it comes to my cat entertainment skills.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca S

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Concept But Needs Work
customer_reviews.text: The white belt moves continually downard, the attached rainbow string pops out of the orange box cat's mouth and disappears at the bottom of the toy again and again. My cat is immediately mesmerized by it. It's a quiet toy, easy to set up and easy to turn on and off, and the design is really cute and fun. My problem is what happens when kitty catches the string with his claws: the belt is stopped and the motor makes a loud squelching noise that frightens him. It's a terrible reward for doing what cats are programmed to do. So I'm really torn about this toy because it really is fun to watch and my cat took to it immediately.
customer_reviews.author: Ashlar

customer_reviews.title: They said cats would buy it themselves if they could
customer_reviews.text: I'm pretty sure my cats would buy one for every doorknob. i've never seen them so obsessed with any of the other toys i've tried buying. i burn through batteries quickly because i just leave it on all the time, when i don't they start pulling on the elastic and it bangs against the door in the middle of the night so they can literally lay there and paw at it or just stare at it. I ended up just buying some rechargeable batteries for it. Since it's running all the time i'll likely be back to buy another in the future.
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: OMG - My cat LOVES this toy!!
customer_reviews.text: I had no idea what kind of reaction my cats would have to this, but boy oh boy was it a hit!!! My one male cat played with this for so long - leaping in the air, attacking it from all angles - he was having a blast! He played with it for so long that he started to pant and I actually had to put it away so he would stop playing and catch his breath. BIG hit - definitely recommend. (AND, it doesn't even have to be on for them to play with it - the string hangs down and he is still attracted to it and 'attacks' - Lots of hours of fun and exercise!)
customer_reviews.author: Vicki

customer_reviews.title: Could be great but stopped working very quickly
customer_reviews.text: My cats absolutely loved this toy! I put it in different places which made it more challenging. Unfortunately about the 3rd time I turned it on for them the motor stopped working. I checked to see if it was the batteries being dead, but no it's completely dead. For the price of this I'd hoped to get a little bit more time out of it! Don't have high expectations of this being a long lasting toy:(.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon B.

customer_reviews.title: Carlos the Cat really digs this
customer_reviews.text: Took ol' Carlos awhile to warm up to this toy. He spent the better part of the first couple months just looking at/stalking it. On the rare occasion he would interact with the string, he nearly pulled it free from the door, creating a loud noise that startled him back into stalk mode. Fast forward another month or two, and he seems to be used to it and interacts with it frequently. If its not currently on, he gives it a big swat anyhow to let us know he wants to play. So in summary, it may have taken a bit - but now easily his favorite toy!
customer_reviews.author: BigChris

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value. Definitely recommended.
customer_reviews.text: This has lived up to all the positive reviews. It seems to be good with battery usage as well - we're several days into using it for 3-5 hours each day and it's still on the initial set of batteries. UPDATE: It is surprisingly strong! There is a large cat who has been trying to dissect this toy - at times I thought he was about to succeed, but... NOPE! All I had to do was reseat the elastic belt at the bottom (he'd gotten it scrunched up on one side of the roller) and all is back to normal. Again, this was money well spent.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Hendricks

customer_reviews.title: Best and most annoying cat toy buy it for your cat and hate yourself for it
customer_reviews.text: The human part of me absolutely hates the story and it is because my car is obsessed with it. He will sit in front of it for hours waiting for me to turn it on and when I do he will sit in front of it for hours watching the string and when the string finally breaks for the batteries run out he will sit in front of it waiting for it to be fixed. What more could one want from a cat toy?
customer_reviews.author: lesetoiles

customer_reviews.title: Great Toy and Outstanding Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: Our cats absolutely adore this toy and spend hours playing. Unfortunately, one of the cats is a chewer and manage to chew through the cord. I contacted MOODY pet and Michele immediately mailed a replacement. As recommended by MOODY I've coated this cord with Elmers Washable Glue which should make it more difficult to chew through the cord. This is by far the best toy our very spoiled cats have ever had. If you go to YouTube and search on Ivan Socher I've posted a few videos entitled: Louise Playing With Her Toy Thelma Loves Her New Toy and Louise Playing With Her Fling-Ama String Cat Toy You'll see how much they enjoy playing.
customer_reviews.author: Ivan D.

customer_reviews.title: They love it!
customer_reviews.text: Got this today and had it ready to go this afternoon. I have quite a few cats (all ages) and they have not quit playing with this yet. As soon as one gets tired (hungry, thirsty, bored?), another one takes over playtime. In over four hours, all but one (the smallest) has played with it. I guess she'll have to wait until the big cats let her get her turn. Not one cat has lost interest yet. No problem using it or setting it up, very easy. It runs quiet, seems very sturdy and hasn't missed a beat. Would buy another...great toy!
customer_reviews.author: WebHost

customer_reviews.title: Our Crazy Russian Blues Are Nuts For This Thing! BOOM!
customer_reviews.text: TL:DR: This thing is awesome. We have had our Pet Fling for nearly a year. Replaced the batteries many times. Reset the ribbon a few times. And took the cover off the works to put the belt back on. It looks like it's been through the trenches in WWI and it still works like the day it was new. The boys have clawed it, pulled it out several feet and slammed it back into the door and otherwise abused it. I think the door will wear out before this thing will!
customer_reviews.author: Robert C. Byrd

customer_reviews.title: No fuss cat toy
customer_reviews.text: Cats are still in the intrigued/scared stage, but want to murder it. My dog is scared to death of it (pretty much scared of everything). It keeps them occupied so it was worth the purchase. It stays on the door way better than I thought it would based on the looks. The kittens caught it and pulled at it several times and it stayed put.
customer_reviews.author: QuarkieSparticle

customer_reviews.title: Could be better - my cats get bored after a few mins of play and walk away
customer_reviews.text: My cats may be atypical, but they seem to time their attacks and this bores them after a few minutes because it is then easy for them to get the string, and they walk away. A suggestion - put in a CPU that makes the string come out at random times from continuous to random delays of a few seconds. Also add feature that shuts itself off after a given amount of time. Of course this will cost more, so that is my suggestion for a premium version. As an embedded engineer, you're talking only a few dollars manufacturing cost to add this, after you pay for the development of course.
customer_reviews.author: David Lethe

customer_reviews.title: Cat's actually love it
customer_reviews.text: I am a multiple cat household, and have bought many toys over the years that the cats lose interest in very quickly. This, although, has them lining up when we turn it on, and waiting to take turns playing with it. It's a toy you can turn on and walk away from and it will provide many minutes of entertainment for each cat. I need to buy more, for more doors in my house, so they each can get more playing time. Stock up on batteries though, because after several hours of fun, you will need to replace them. They seem to last a long time, considering how much we use it.
customer_reviews.author: Sherry Kircher

customer_reviews.title: Cats think it’s OK!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 4 cats as a Christmas present. The one I received seems much slower than the videos I have seen. I really thought they would love this because of all the great reviews. The first day 2 of the 4 cats were interested in it. The next day they don’t even bother with it. Very disappointing! I ended up keeps it because I bought it through Amazon Warehouse for $15.00. If it was anymore I would have returned it
customer_reviews.author: BeckyT24

customer_reviews.title: Great product!  My kitties LOVE LOVE LOVE them!
customer_reviews.text: My kitties LOVE these!! I have two of these and they have been used SO much that the elastic band on one of them is totally stretched out. The company is sending me a replacement, so my kitties will be happy again! These are great fun for you to watch and great fun for them to play with. I highly recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: M. J. Elmore

customer_reviews.title: Best cat toy I have bought in well over 5 years.
customer_reviews.text: This is the ONLY toy one of my cats will play with now. He begs for it to be turned on. We even have to put it away at night because he will sit and pull at the elastic until the string comes out and then yank on it and slam the whole toy into the door. This toy is THAT AWESOME for the cats. And even after all the tearing at the elastic and yanking on the string until the motor slips, this toy is still running strong after multiple months of constant use. If your cat is addicted to this toy like mine is, I would recommend using rechargeable batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Alix

customer_reviews.title: Once my cats stopped being afraid of it... they couldn't care less about playing with it.
customer_reviews.text: I have to score this based on how my cats reacted. They appeared to give it one star (or less), so I rate this on their behalf. From my own point of view, I will also note that the string seemed to get caught in the belt with relative frequency (every 10-15 minutes) resulting in the device going dead and requiring me to disentangle the string.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Powers

customer_reviews.title: QUIET TOY FOR SCARED CATSI
customer_reviews.text: I HAD THIS ON FOR 1/2 HOUR AT A TIME BATTERIES HELD UP FINE. FITS ON LEVER DOOR KNOBS. QUIET DOESN'T SCARE MY CAT. BUT SHE DID GET SCARED WHEN SHE PULLED THE STRING AND IT PULLED THE WHOLE THING AND WHEN SHE LET GO IT BANGED LOUDLY AGAINST THE DOOR I AM GOING TO GLUE FELT FABRIC ON THE WHOLE PLASTIC BACKSIDE. I'VE BOUGHT 10 DIFFERENT TOYS SHE ONLY PLAYS WITH THE LASERS AND NOW THIS ONE.
customer_reviews.author: 2old2care

customer_reviews.title: A home run purchase!
customer_reviews.text: My 3 cats are absolutely wild about this toy. I anticipated them having some interest given its mechanic to move a string around, but the response I got was so much more. They all immediately come when they hear it start, sit in a semi circle, and take turns attacking and catching the string. My two boys are heavy hitters and play rough, sometimes pulling on the string so hard to close the door, but the band immediately snaps back to position and keeps going! Sometimes I find a cat waiting in the room where the toy’s door is, hoping I’ll let them play. I’m so happy with this product and I’ll definitely get more in the future!
customer_reviews.author: bestwhit

customer_reviews.title: NONE OF MY THREE CATS WOULD PLAY WITH IT!!
customer_reviews.text: I have three cats -- an old playful girl and one young male Siamese who is always ready to rumble and a shyer two-year old female. NONE of them AND I MEAN NONE OF THEM liked this toy. I tried it in different locations, and the result was the same. They looked at it and walked away. I bought one of these for each of my three adult children since they all own cats. Two of the three werre somewhat intrigued by the toy, but the third was also disinterested. It looks great in concept. Unfortunately, the cats weren't consulted!
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth S.

customer_reviews.title: My cat’s really into it
customer_reviews.text: Even though this thing is a cheap piece of you know what and goes through batteries like it’s going out of style, my cat is obsessed with it. Sometimes he just sits in front of it and lets the string hit him in the face. He doesn’t even care. He just loves it.
customer_reviews.author: John K

customer_reviews.title: Do you want to play a game?
customer_reviews.text: My cat watches in torment for hours on end as the string comes just within his grasps, then suddenly slips away once more. As if the designers knew that this device would turn into a sort of sick game, they have input 2 “levels”. I recommend starting with level 2. On level 2, your cat will be completely overwhelmed. Once your cat has given up all hope, switch to level 1, and draw them back in.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian

customer_reviews.title: Yeahhhhh NO!
customer_reviews.text: Received in the mail today and couldn’t wait to put it together for my cats who love to play. After reading instructions and putting it together, it was ready to go, however, it comes in two speeds. Speed One does not work! Speed Two runs well. $25 spent on this so called great toy for cats is a big NOT!! Let’s see how long this thing lasts before I leave another feedback on this cat toy! Really Amazon? Really? You can do better than this!!
customer_reviews.author: S. Kalal

customer_reviews.title: My four cats love this toy
customer_reviews.text: All of my cats like to play with this toy. I made sure to use rechargeable batteries so they are never without it. We did have an issue with a slow motor, but customer service was excellent and sent out a new one right away, tested, a year after we purchased. We have had no issues with string coming loose and if the belt twists, it's easy to straighten out and easy to clean if you have to remove the wheel.
customer_reviews.author: A.M. Nixon

customer_reviews.title: Great way to distract a mischievous kitten
customer_reviews.text: We've got a kitten that loves to attack shoe laces while you're trying to tie them. He also enjoys trying to climb your legs using his claws while you're on important phone calls. Turning this you on during those times when you really need a break from the kitten is very effective. It keeps him distracted for quite a while. He has found ways to defeat it twice now. The first time he tied a couple of big knots in the string which jammed up the whole device, and the other time he put a few twists into the white belt which slowed it down until it eventually stopped.
customer_reviews.author: Frankie

customer_reviews.title: A hit!
customer_reviews.text: My 20-year-old cat Grace doesn’t get excited over much but she will play with this for 20 minutes at a time and after six weeks, she still loves it. My jumpy eight-year-old cat did not like the quiet hum of the motor but did take several swings at it. You can tell it’s well-made and I was glad to see it hooks on the paddle type door knobs as well. Even with new batteries it doesn’t go very fast on high speed but it seems adequate. The string is one of those nylon silky round types. The only improvement I could think of would be to have a white string which I think cats can see better.
customer_reviews.author: Manderley

customer_reviews.title: Keeps active cats busy
customer_reviews.text: My cats love this!!! They hear it turn on and they come running. I thought they would break it right away but it's more durable than it looks. We have 4 active cats and use several toys to keep them busy. My only complaint is that it's noisy. Also, it would be great to have an auto shut off like some of our other toys. Other than those two things, the Fling-ama-String is awesome. We enjoy watching our cats try to figure out how to outsmart the string. Fun for people and pets alike!!
customer_reviews.author: Creativetype

customer_reviews.title: My cat is so strung out! Loves this!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Update: this thing has to run a LOT due to my cat’s love of this toy, and it’s taking a lot of abuse from him. I will attach a video of how much he loves it even after more than a month of play. Original: My cat became addicted to this right away. My only concern is that he will wear it out too quickly and I will have to buy more. He has learned to paw at it and ask to have it turned on. He get so tired he just lays next to it on his back and pause at the string as it passes him. I highly recommend us to entertain your kitty.
customer_reviews.author: SouthernNYCMelle

customer_reviews.title: My Cat Said "Meh"
customer_reviews.text: This product seems like a good idea, but you never know how your cat will react until you open it up. My cat was not interested in this at all. He seemed wary of it, and ultimately avoided it altogether, Still, I think this just depends on the mood and temperament of your cat. Mine doesn't like toys that move on their own like this one, nor does he like fishing rod type cat toys. If your cat doesn't mind moving toys, you may want to try this one. It looks like it could be good exercise, especially for an indoor cat.
customer_reviews.author: Ruth H. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Would anyone like to have this thing for free?
customer_reviews.text: My cat found this interesting for about 5 minutes, then has ignored it since. No matter how I try to get her to play with it she simply walks away from it and I can't get her to participate. She will sit there and look at me like "you're kidding, right?". I regret I will have to take it down. If anyone wants this thing, they can have it for free.
customer_reviews.author: Dale P.

customer_reviews.title: Make it with a sensor!
customer_reviews.text: The track got knocked off a couple times and tangled and crimped after only a couple weeks, but it still works well and was easy to fix. Only thing is I wish they had a little on/off remote or sensor. I’ll turn it off to save battery and then my cat will meow at me to turn it back on. I turn it back on, she’ll play/watch it for a few minutes, then walk away. So I turn it off. Then the cycle repeats. I basically have to supervise her, which is the opposite purpose of this toy. Batteries aren’t cheap. Make it with a sensor, or even rechargeable via USB, and you could make bank!
customer_reviews.author: N. A.

customer_reviews.title: After two months, cat still is mesmerized.
customer_reviews.text: My cats absolutely loved this for a while. We pull it out perhaps once a week for 30 minutes or so, more initially. The kitten has gotten good at catching and pulling the string hard. After two months, they still will play with it, flop near it and watch it. Some of the excitement is gone. But here's the important bit: It was what, $25-ish. And has delivered hours of entertainment. With a battery change, still going strong. Not a bad deal, even if it were to break today. (Which it didn't.)
customer_reviews.author: -TMcN-

customer_reviews.title: Wasn’t worth it for us.
customer_reviews.text: My cats played with it for 5 minutes and now it just hangs there. This is literally a string attached to a piece of elastic that goes around and around. Gets boring for them quickly. Not worth it for us. May be good for smaller kittens.
customer_reviews.author: julie Pizzitola

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: This toy is a godsend for one of my cats definitely not both but my girl cat is hard to please when it comes to toys and she absolutely loses it over this toy, she can sit there as long as this thing has battery life. On that note though definitely invest in rechargeable batteries for this thing cuz if you leave it on like I do for my cat you're going to eat through batteries
customer_reviews.author: Kstrong

customer_reviews.title: Fun and funny contraption
customer_reviews.text: The cats are fascinated by it. One immediately plays with it, the other tends toward cautiously approaching and then playing. It's not as noisy as some batter-powered cat toys, which is nice. And it's unique. I can't yet review sturdiness or durability, because I haven't owned it very long, but will update my review at a later time. Price is OK - could be better.
customer_reviews.author: cbb

customer_reviews.title: Kitties love this!
customer_reviews.text: So much so that two of my friends asked me to order one for each of their Kitties. And I have Kitties that are rather odd about their toys - I'm never quite sure what they will like. This one was a huge hit. Good idea to put rechargeable batteries in, because you must turn it on and off by a switch, and you want long life for this thing - it does go through batteries. But Kitties say it's fun, so we soldier on.
customer_reviews.author: Joani

customer_reviews.title: My cat mastered it fairly quickly, but I still give this toy credit
customer_reviews.text: If your cat is super athletic like mine, it may very well end up figuring out this type pretty quickly. But that doesn't mean it's not a clever toy that engages cats, it definitely is one of the more novel designs, and even though my cat now can stare it down and "catch" the string in one try, my guess is that most cats will not be so lucky. In the grand scheme of things, it kept my cat entertained for longer than just about anything aside from a laser pointer. That's quite an accomplishment for any cat toy.
customer_reviews.author: Mark H.

customer_reviews.title: Cats love it
customer_reviews.text: I love it, but more importantly so do my two cats (mother and son); they were fascinated. I enjoyed watching them. This is a relatively easy toy to get going, no assembly. The only thing I would say is that the manufacturer probably is not aware that there is a movement to replace all knobs with lever-type door knobs (for handicapped), etc. So, some modification of how the toy affixes to "door knob" probably warranted: make it attaches to door lever--which needs more attention than hooking it over an actual knob.
customer_reviews.author: NightHeron

customer_reviews.title: Cat enjoys after an adjustment
customer_reviews.text: My cat was uninterested at first until I watched for a bit and saw why. The string was much easier for him to grab after I reversed the direction it traveled by reversing polarity of batteries (install each one in opposite direction as directed). I'm still trying to find a better way to mount it. I wish it could mount horizontally also. Otherwise overall, it does quiet well.
customer_reviews.author: Vic

customer_reviews.title: Cat approved!
customer_reviews.text: We have 4 adult cats ranging in age from 5 years to 14 years. Three of our cats love it. One cat, Steve will monopolize it because he loves it to much, I have to make him share this toy with his siblings. I ordered the first one 3 years ago, it just died and I ordered another one. The batteries last a good while before changing unless your furkids are addicts like mine. I switched to rechargeable batteries.
customer_reviews.author: KaraAnn

customer_reviews.title: All string, no fling!
customer_reviews.text: If the string actually flickered out, maybe my cat would've liked it. The white conveyor belt part goes 'round and 'round, but the string just sticks to it. It does NOT flail out like the photo. At all. No matter what speed, how you hang it or mess with it. As such, all the cats we tried it with just lied there and looked at it. No fun, and definitely no exercise. Too bad, it's a great idea!
customer_reviews.author: M.S.H.

customer_reviews.title: but this is their favorite. Even after they are too tired out to ...
customer_reviews.text: Our cats have enough toys that I worry about spoiling them, but this is their favorite. Even after they are too tired out to chase the string, they'll sit there watching it, sometimes for an hour or more. The toy is durable, too - one of ours likes to catch the string and pull on it to stretch out the elastic band, and then she'll catch the band and chew on it. She's chewed most of the way through the band, but the toy itself has shown no distress from this treatment. Replacing the band is easy - there are instructions on the manufacturer's website and they will send replacement bands for the asking. Nice folks, good product, highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Brent&Dawn

customer_reviews.title: My cat LOVES this toy!
customer_reviews.text: Tigger is enthralled! He lays on the floor now while still playing with the toy as it goes up and down. This product seems well made - I just got it today, so I'll update if it breaks quickly or anything. It is very quiet, which is good so the cats aren't scared off. They are really sensitive to noise. Overall this is a hit! I think I'll need to buy another one as Tigger won't let Annie at it.
customer_reviews.author: Maureen

customer_reviews.title: Cat TV To Cat Toy In 24 Hours
customer_reviews.text: 2 black cats. Day one they both just sat there watching the string go around, like "cat TV" or something...no participation despite my efforts to model acceptable behavior 😂 Day 2 one of these guys (Jack Black) is all over it with a vengeance while cat 2 (Hector Kittyboy) is still in cat tv mode. We look forward to what tomorrow may bring. Great toy. One suggestion for the manufacturer: fix the battery compartment. I had to stuff cardboard pieces between the batteries and on top of them so they'd stay in place.
customer_reviews.author: Jule

customer_reviews.title: Fun, but doesn't last
customer_reviews.text: My cats really enjoyed this toy, and it was a great distraction. But it runs through batteries very quickly, even though I was only running it for short periods of time. The instructions say that you should always supervise the cats, but of course I walked into the other room and they ripped the elastic runner off and destroyed it. I'm torn on this review, because it was a great toy, but I had it for a couple weeks at most, and I ran through a big pack of batteries and now it's destroyed. It's a bit too pricey for me to replace after just two weeks.
customer_reviews.author: zakiue

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT WASTE MONEY.
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves this, but let me get one thing clear.. THIS IS NOT WORTH $28. Within the first day of having this product my cat destroyed the cheap string, and now it gets caught every single time the thing tries to spin. It is not at all sturdy on the door and is loud when my cat is playing with it because it just hits against the door constantly. It lasted about 3 days before it completely stopped working because the string was so frayed and destroyed.. Poor design of a product-- good idea though.
customer_reviews.author: Z

customer_reviews.title: Works for certain cats
customer_reviews.text: I thought this would be perfect for my Birman who has so much energy and can't get enough of playtime. However, if you know you have a smart cat breed, this definitely won't do the trick for them. He'll be excited about it for about 30 seconds, and then once he figures out the continuous pattern of a string being flung out predictably, he'll walk away and watch it passively for another minute and then find something else to do. Wasn't worth the money for me, but I'm sure other rambunctious cat breeds would benefit a lot from this, just not my picky fluffer!
customer_reviews.author: Ji

customer_reviews.title: My cats love it but it drains battery's fast
customer_reviews.text: I have 2, 9 lb female cats who well watch this thing as long as it runs which helps when I have projects to finish and they want my attention. This also does not fit on my door, and I would say I have a standard house door. So I dont know exactly where you are suppose to put it? However it doesnt run that long, it well completely drain 3 AA batteries in 45-60 mins. Yes I am serious 3 AA batteries in 45 - 60 mins. That gets pricey fast. I have literally never seen something drain power as fast this motor does in my entire life.
customer_reviews.author: Dusty

customer_reviews.title: Nope
customer_reviews.text: Lasted about 15 minutes before dying. Also, one of my pet peeves is products that ship with no batteries. This requires 3 AAA. So instead of being able to set it up for my cat and use right away, I have to make a trip to the store tomorrow because I only have 2 batteries on hand. BOO!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Both cats enjoy this thing in their own weird ways. It's great!
customer_reviews.text: Both cats enjoy this thing in their own weird ways. It's great! I use it as a pre feeding ritual to stimulate the stalk-chase-catch part of the natural cycle. It helps. They eat less and then nap for a while. It's been very durable. I've had to replace the string twice in six months, but that was expected and easy. Sometimes the string gets caught a bit on its track but usually a cat unsticks it anyway. The motor is strong but not loud- you can still talk or watch a TV nearby. We love it!
customer_reviews.author: kpkeack

customer_reviews.title: Worth it, would buy again
customer_reviews.text: I have an indoor only 7 year old cat that absolutely loves this thing. Only thing I would suggest is find a way to secure the black elastic strap or maybe the toy itself to the front of the door to better minimize banging of the toy when a cat is trying to get the string. Overall, seems like somewhat cheap plastic but the conveyor belt works well and immediately resumes action once tension on the string is released.
customer_reviews.author: Kelsey M.

customer_reviews.title: Cat too smart
customer_reviews.text: My cat is a hunter (on leash and harness but I don't let him kill). I thought he would love this. He either knows it isn't a lizard and isn't interested, or he just doesn't 'get' it. He does stare at it and is interested but not interested enough to 'hunt' it. I am going, however, to take it to the Shelter when I go and play with the kittens. I bet they will LOVE it.
customer_reviews.author: sheridannomore

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant cat toy
customer_reviews.text: If you have a cat that enjoys strings or shoe laces, BUY THIS !!!! My cat loves this toy so much. Even my second cat, who doesn’t typically play much, is very intrigued and will bat at it a bit. It is so simple to set up, turn it on, and leave her to play with while I’m doing other things. Currently I am on bed rest from surgery with very limited mobility for a couple days. Fling-ama-string is keeping her entertained and me as well, watching her have fun puts a big smile on my face :)
customer_reviews.author: Micah Tolle

customer_reviews.title: Great, burns through batteries
customer_reviews.text: My cats love it. I've already burned through two sets of batteries. When it is off, even though I make sure the string is not showing, they'll pull at it to get it out. If it's off, and I walk near it, they meow at me to turn it on. They do lose interest after a while, then it just keeps on going. I thought it had an auto-shutoff, but it does not. Motion sensing would be amazing, since their interest comes and goes. But maybe rechargeable batteries are the answer.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy

customer_reviews.title: Not safe for every cat
customer_reviews.text: My cat loved the toy, but he REALLY wanted the string off that belt. Has used it a handful of times. A couple of times he had grabbed it with his mouth and tried to walk away with it by yanking at the string, but the sting didn’t give away. Now my cat is having issues opening his jaw. He is an older cat, but is hard on his toys.
customer_reviews.author: LT

customer_reviews.title: Don't bother
customer_reviews.text: Yet another cat toy I need to replace often. The string gets stuck to band, I'm assuming due to static electricity, within 10 min of startng it, RIGHT OUT OF THE PACKAGE. The only way to get it to drop is to stick the end of the string in water to create a little weight so it drops. Even with that it only drops 6 or 7 times then is stunk to band again. Great toy if it worked
customer_reviews.author: Cyn

customer_reviews.title: Awesome, but.
customer_reviews.text: So this toy is amazing and my cat loves it!!!! She COULD play with it for hours. So it would have been a 5 star however the. Arteries drain so quickly. Mostly because it's a manual on off switch. If it stayed on for 10 minutes or so and shut off automatically it would be perfect but you cannot turn it on and leave otherwise you come home to dead batteries. Maybe an option where the cat could paw it on and then it turns off after awhile? For the price I didn't expect this kind of issue. Otherwise it's an awesome concept.
customer_reviews.author: jawajeannie

customer_reviews.title: Lasted maybe 10 minutes
customer_reviews.text: I received this was super excited to get set up for my boys, set it up, hung it on door & within, MAYBE 10minutes, if that, the string thing was pulled off and boom!! Was done for!
customer_reviews.author: KGriffberg

customer_reviews.title: Awesome, Entertaining for everyone
customer_reviews.text: This is probably the best game I have found for my 2 young and very rambunctious cats. They have been suffering from cabin fever lately, with the heat and humidity, so the catio is out of the question, but this keeps them entertained for hours, longer than the laser light toys. Huge surprise to me. THANK YOU!
customer_reviews.author: Beth Campeau

customer_reviews.title: good design, but broke the second day
customer_reviews.text: Sadly the toy stopped working on the second day, but my 6 yr old cat really liked it. She is 15 lbs and when she caught the string it was sturdy enough not to break as she kept pulling on it. It is a bit noisy and runs constantly until shut off. Make sure the string is captured on the inside of the device when it is shut off to keep string from being nibbled on. I only ran it for 15 minutes each time to keep her from getting bored with it, but it would not start the third time even with new batteries, thus returned.
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: Great toy!!
customer_reviews.text: My cats love this. They know where the string disappeared, and even when it's off, they try to get the string. He even ripped it off the door at one point.
customer_reviews.author: firemedic2008

customer_reviews.title: Too Easy
customer_reviews.text: No matter how long I wait to bring this toy out again my cat catches the string almost immediately. The longest it has managed to hold his attention is maybe three minutes and that was when I first received this item. I will say that when every time I bring it out he is immediately interested, though it doesn't last long. Additionally I'm not a fan of the design. The cat face and ears look ridiculous. I wish it were less obnoxious looking so I didn't have to put it away every time I had guests.
customer_reviews.author: C K

customer_reviews.title: Meh.
customer_reviews.text: I got this thinking it was more than it is. In my mind this actually shot out a string like a tongue; in reality it's a string on a belt that loops over and over. The string merely drops down after clearing the top and then gets sucked back into the housing. My cat did stare at it (even going after the string once or twice) however it's cheaply made, overpriced and runs on batteries with no option for a power plug. It only has two speeds too, though I couldn't tell the difference between them.
customer_reviews.author: Paul G

customer_reviews.title: Our cat loves this toy!
customer_reviews.text: Not only does the Fling-ama-String come in delightfully fun packaging, it is clever and very well thought out. So simple to attach to the door and so far seems pretty much indestructible. The string is nice and tough and firmly attached; that was my main concern. Our cat rapidly learned that she needs us to turn it on for her and she "asks" us to do it.
customer_reviews.author: A bookworm

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny! Even picky cats love this toy!
customer_reviews.text: This has been such a hit in our house. Our cat is very particular about her toys. It usually takes her some time to warm up to most toys. She had no warm-up time to love this toy. She immediately went after the string. She actually rubs on it when she wants us to turn it on. We have already went through batteries and we have only had it about 3 weeks. Granted we have been using it a decent amount but I wish they would last just a smidge longer. This is worth every penny! It has kept our cat very active.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Cats Run From It
customer_reviews.text: This was a waste of money. The cat head thing at teh top gets in the way of closing the door I put it on. It's easy enough to push it aside, but kind of annoying. The batteries died after 30 minutes of use. But the worst part is that my cats ran away from it. It makes a loud clicking whir as ti turns, and my cats just didn't trust it. Everyone else here says their cats loved it, but for me at least, this was just another cheap gadget marketed to gullible humans like me.
customer_reviews.author: Elphaba Eucrow

customer_reviews.title: Neither Cats nor Humans impressed
customer_reviews.text: Cats really not interested and when they are, break it quickly. You have to really babysit and waste of money imo. You want something unbreakable and cats love? Go for Smartykat Hot Pursuit cat toy. We bought both at Christmas, only one was being used the day after Christmas and that one is still being used today. Cat no like, no other uses for this.
customer_reviews.author: Amazoncustomer

customer_reviews.title: Motor noise scares my cat
customer_reviews.text: I tried and tried to get my cat interested, but he was always bothered by the noise of the motor. I gave it to a friend with multiple cats and they weren't interested. Not sure what's up with all the positive reviews. It also is just a tad bit too large so that it gets in the way of opening and closing the door easily.
customer_reviews.author: D. Douglas

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't last long
customer_reviews.text: My cat really liked this for a while. The fact that the speed can be adjusted is good. She even like chasing the string from the opposite side of the door. However, with all of her play it started to go really slow. Then because she continued to catch the string and pull, it only lasted about a year before she stretched out all the elasticity. Now she won't even look at it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Boring, Cheaply Made
customer_reviews.text: Its cute but its made of cheap plastic. It did not come with batteries. The switch is hard to work. It skips over the settings easily. It runs all the time so it isn't cat activated. All forgivable if the cat liked it, but he does not. He bats at it a bit, then gets bored. I think the string is too slow and maybe too predictable. I think I could make him a better one. A DC motor, some elastic and a bigger opening to allow some fluffy feathers could work.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My cats absolutely loved it for a day
customer_reviews.text: My cats absolutely loved it for a day. Now I can't get them to look at it. I was really hoping for something that could get their attention without me having to do anything. My cats cry at the door when I go to work, my girlfriend is always telling me how upset they get when I leave. They are up my butt big time, so I was really hoping for a way they could have fun, while giving me a break. Although they will be interested for 5 or 10 minutes at a time, it's not what I was hoping for.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew A. Schneider

customer_reviews.title: video is disingenuous
customer_reviews.text: This "toy" just loops a string over and over and my cats are in no way interested. The video makes it look like there is a motion sensor of some kind but no. It's just a simple motor. This is not a good toy for cats.
customer_reviews.author: Jared Grippe

customer_reviews.title: This thing is like cat crack
customer_reviews.text: This thing is like cat crack. My 5 month old kitten absolutely loves this toy, she will wait by the door for us to turn it on for her. She's started biting the white band that pulls the threat around and is just destroying it, but it's still working (so far)! Really awesome toy for a playful but spoiled kitten. We've had it for a week now, and she hasn't gotten sick of it yet (and she gets sick of toys easily!) She's able to find the thread even if you turn the toy off when the thread is behind the white band, so it's probably best to hide this toy when you're not around.
customer_reviews.author: Martie

customer_reviews.title: This works!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is the bomb!! Most fun watching your cat “think” while trying to figure out the best way to catch the string Cats are very smart and it is our duty to keep them guessing
customer_reviews.author: Conjurer

customer_reviews.title: Save Your Money
customer_reviews.text: Our cat was interested in this toy for not more than five minutes. That’s about $5.00 a minute and a little overpriced when you look at it that way. Now, your cat may love this for hours on end. I don’t recommend this toy at this price. Further, a strong, active cat will likely break this toy in short order. In general, I’ve had better luck with much simpler, less expensive toys.
customer_reviews.author: Thorne HamstringTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: My cat loves this toy!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased toy over 3 years ago, my cat plays with it for at least an hour a day. Finally the two elastic bands wore out. I emailed company, received a reply within a day and replacement bands two days later. GREAT customer service!! Highly recommend product and the company that supports there product.
customer_reviews.author: Anne Marie

customer_reviews.title: Kinda cheap. Cats loved it. Too wide.
customer_reviews.text: This drove both our cats and us crazy—they loved it, but it always got in the way of opening and closing the dang door. One of the ears? horns? broke off. I took it apart to see if I could adjust its width at the top, but decided it wasn’t even worth putting back together and salvaged the components. The design is cost engineered to an impressive level.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie W.

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 3 uses
customer_reviews.text: This product stopped working after three uses. I replaced the batteries with new ones, straight out of a brand new pack, but it still won't work. While I'm outside the return window now, I'll contact Amazon to see if they will give a refund. While it was functional, my 17yo cat, who doesn't do anything but sleep these days, enjoyed it - and we tried a ton of options. Oh well.
customer_reviews.author: BAR

customer_reviews.title: Please be aware - this toy is Dangerous
customer_reviews.text: I never write reviews. I thought this was a great toy. But my cat threw up about 4" of pink string this morning! After cleaning up the mess. I immediately came and wrote this. I should have listened to the other reviewers warning about their cats swallowing the string. I guess somehow I thought "my cat would Never do that." But she did. Thank goodness she threw it up and it did not get into her digestive tract like others have mentioned. Please be aware this of the danger of this cat toy.
customer_reviews.author: K Santiago

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product for easily bored kitties
customer_reviews.text: Totally worth the money. Keeps my high energy 8 month old kitten busy so I can finally sleep past 5:40am!!! The box came really beat up and opened but nothing was damaged or missing. The only bad part is I only have the lever style door knobs in my house and my cat has already figured out how to slide the s hook off the knob and take the toy down, but I’m sure with a regular round door knob this would not be possible. I love this toy and my cat loves it too, great product for smart and active cats.
customer_reviews.author: viczlo

customer_reviews.title: Be warned if your feline friend doesn’t like high speed toys
customer_reviews.text: I finally got around to setting this up for my kitty, and lo and behold, it doesn’t work. It only works on one speed, the fastest, and my kitty is too nervous to even get close. I don’t think it’s worth it
customer_reviews.author: Dramane

customer_reviews.title: Occupied Kitties!
customer_reviews.text: My kitties love this toy! They are fascinated by it. I work at home and inevitably there are times when the kitties are bored and want some attention and as much as I would like to, I can't give it to them, so they start causing mischief, walking on they keyboard, etc., anyone with a cat knows what I mean. I turn the "Pet Fling" on and they gather round, they take turns grabbing the string, pulling the string, they stare at it, they examine it and it totally engrosses them. I leave it on for about 15 minutes, then turn it off until the next time. The stimulation satisfies them and they are happy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: All eight cats LOVE it!
customer_reviews.text: I rescued six kittens and already had two "old ladies" at home. They ALL love this toy. I wanted to make sure it was safe and would not be a choking hazard and so far, it seems to be safe. I still only turn it on when I am home so that I can watch them play with it. They are fascinated with the ever-active string and they actually take turns playing with it. I may buy another one just to give them more play time. Excellent toy.
customer_reviews.author: Mollydogbiscuits

customer_reviews.title: Our cat is obsessed!
customer_reviews.text: I got this as an early Christmas gift for our 1 year old cat. She absolutely loves it. We've had it for a day and she's been actively playing with this toy for hours. I am a little worried that she is too rough with the toy, but so far everything is holding up.
customer_reviews.author: Angel S

customer_reviews.title: Entertains my cats
customer_reviews.text: My cats love this toy. My two mainecoon's get on either side of the door and play for quite a while. You'll need rechargeable batteries if you want to leave it on for extended periods of time. Basically if your cat goes crazy for strings or ribbons, they will love this toy and all you have to do is set it up.
customer_reviews.author: Moons of Jupiter

customer_reviews.title: Genius design
customer_reviews.text: A little costly. They must have a good profit margin. That said, the quality is decent/fine and it's a lot of fun. I ended up putting it on the back of a chair and it turned out good as my cat can attack from different sides and from under the chair. The only improvement I could suggest is a timer. Its like crack for a cat. He will play with this as long as it is on.I have to turn it off just so he can rest. The most impressive feature is when the cat does catch the string it gives some and the motor stops and starts effortlessly. Overall good buy in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Irma H.

customer_reviews.title: My cats love it!
customer_reviews.text: My cats love this toy and beg to have it turned on. We used so many batteries so quickly that we finally got rechargeable. The cats will wait eagerly while we change the batteries. It's so cute. My one complaint is that I wish it had an automatic shutoff after a certain time.
customer_reviews.author: BookStorm

product_meta.title: Moody Pet Fling
product_meta.description: Size:1 CountMulti-Award Winning, battery-operated string-flinging machine…If cats had money, they’d buy one. No cat can live on sleep and food alone. They need a little Fling-Ama-String too. This action-packed toy hangs on any standard door knob. One end of a long, brightly-colored, silky cord (string) is sewn (with an industrial strength sewing machine.) onto a white elastic “conveyer belt” which is constantly rotating. The string flings in and out for kitty’s non-stop amusement. Cats can bite, paw, claw, pull, and ultimately STOP the string. As soon as they let go, the string automatically starts to rotate again and again and again. The toy has 2 speeds for the frisky or faint feline. Just turn it on, take a seat, and watch kitty go. Fling-Ama-String snafu or need a replacement part? Go to moodypet.com Fling-Ama-String Tips and Troubleshooting for more information. Moody Pet sends out FREE replacement parts for the life of your toy. Please supervise your cat at all times when playing with this toy.
feature_bullets: A battery-operated string-flinging machine offering nonstop entertainment for kitty (takes 3 AA batteries not included; also takes rechargeable! Best with Polaroid AA Batteries)
Multi Award Winning including Editor's Choice in Cat Fancy Magazine and Best New Product of the Year at the most prestigious pet product trade shows in the world
Best Cat Toy Ever! Say a gazillion of over-joyed kitties around the world! check out the AWESOME KITTY ON FLING-AMA-STRING ACTION VIDEO on this page!

Perfect for every type of cat: kitten, young at heart, full-figured, senior, or just plain lazybones Go to moody pet for Fling-Amar-String Tips and Troubleshooting; Moody Pet offers FREE-replacement parts for the life of your toy

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
